Alabama Sen: Jeff Sessions' statement at the Republican National Convention, where he claimed that Hillary Clinton "has been a champion of globalist trade agreements" and specifically mentioned the Trans-Pacific Partnership agreement.
The fact: checker's analysis of Sessions' claim, highlighting that he painted Clinton's position on free trade with an overly broad brush and was incorrect in stating her support for the Trans-Pacific Partnership.
The expert: s examination of Clinton's history on free trade, noting that she supported eight deals, opposed two, flip-flopped on three, and had different opinions on various trade deals throughout her career.
